;美国和中国之间持续的紧张局势引发了一场争夺影响力的竞赛南半球，太平洋岛屿正在成为具有重要战略意义的地区。近几十年来，美国在积极参与太平洋岛国方面的努力一直落后，但拜登政府最近采取的行动试图扭转这一趋势。

;

;美国忽视这个地缘政治重要地区的事实造成了对中国来说是一个有利的机会，北京去年与所罗门群岛签署了一项安全协定就凸显了这一点。作为回应，美国增加了在该地区的存在，包括在瓦努阿图开设大使馆并于去年 9 月主办了第一届美国-太平洋岛屿峰会。

;

;这种接触的提升本应在美国总统乔拜登历史性的巴布亚新几内亚之行。但拜登决定优先考虑国内问题，缩短印太之行。这是一个战略失误，助长了中国关于美国对该地区投入不足的说法。

;

;拜登回国后不久就返回印太地区，参加在日本举行的七国集团峰会。在峰会期间，七国集团领导人表达了加强与全球南方国家接触的愿望。即便如此，他们的话只有在真正涉及与这些国家进行经济和外交接触的具体行动之后才会有意义。

;

;拜登政府意识到了这一点，并已着手与太平洋地区重新接触状态。最值得注意的是美国参与自由联合协定 (COFA)，这是美国、密克罗尼西亚、马绍尔群岛和帕劳之间的一系列条约。这些协议还概述了美国对南太平洋岛屿的财政承诺。去年 3 月，美国大使 Joseph Yun 被任命为特使，负责监督紧凑型谈判。

;

;上个月末，国务院宣布了新的 COFA 协议。 5月22日，国务卿安东尼·布林肯出席美国-帕劳2023年协定签字仪式。第二天，国务院报告称与密克罗尼西亚签署了三项新的 COFA 协议。这些旨在支持经济发展并帮助建立应对气候变化的能力。

;

;此外，尽管拜登决定不访问巴布亚新几内亚，但美国积极参加了上个月在巴布亚新几内亚举行的第二届美国-太平洋岛屿论坛国家首都莫尔兹比港。该论坛包括来自整个地区的官员，包括澳大利亚和新西兰。根据白宫的一份声明，这次会议重申了“建立一个和平、和谐、安全、社会包容和繁荣的富有弹性的太平洋地区的共同愿景”。

;

;在论坛期间，布林肯强调了 72 亿美元的美国为太平洋岛屿地区提供的新资金和计划。国务院还强调了作为美国-太平洋岛屿伙伴关系一部分的不同可交付成果。这包括签署 COFA 协议、填补长期空缺的大使馆职位、和平队返回该地区、启动美国太平洋地区新锐领袖研究所、重申应对海平面上升的政策等等。

;

;美国国际开发署 (USAID) 在与太平洋岛国的交往中也发挥了积极作用。例如，在第二次美国-太平洋岛屿论坛领导人会议上，布林肯宣布美国国际开发署将向巴布亚新几内亚提供 2300 万美元的额外援助，以加强和平与安全计划，促进可持续和公平的经济增长，并支持有弹性的健康社区

;

;今年早些时候，美国国际开发署拨款 320 万美元用于人道主义救济，以帮助支持从热带气旋朱迪和凯文中恢复过来，这只是该地区众多举措中的两项。

;

;此外，值得注意的是，美国的盟友也在加强与南太平洋国家的互动。澳大利亚和新西兰历来与太平洋岛屿关系密切，而韩国现在表明它打算在该地区发挥更大的作用。首尔于 5 月 29 日举行首届太平洋岛国峰会时强调了这一点。

;

;在对中国的担忧中，韩国举办了首届太平洋岛国领导人峰会

;

;在峰会上，18 个国家参加了此次峰会来自太平洋岛屿论坛的韩国表示，它打算到 2027 年将其对该地区的发展援助规模扩大一倍，并协助保护其海域。

;

;与此同时，印度举行了第三次印度-太平洋岛屿5月下旬的合作峰会。在峰会期间，总理纳伦德拉·莫迪公布了一项旨在推进他的国家与太平洋岛国合作的 12 步倡议。

;

;拜登政府意识到北京提出的反美言论，并正在齐心协力，展示其对该地区的奉献精神。在第一次美国-太平洋岛国峰会期间宣布的蓝色太平洋大陆 2050 年战略为华盛顿改善与该地区的接触提供了框架。

;

;确保该战略取得成功并促进关系繁荣，美国增加对该地区的经济和外交承诺至关重要。如果华盛顿保持目前的做法，它将向太平洋岛屿和中国证明，它真正致力于在该地区发挥重要作用。

;一架从德里飞往旧金山的印度航空公司飞机被迫改道并降落在该航空公司周二表示，俄罗斯远东的一个机场在其中一台发动机出现技术问题后。

;

;波音 777 宽体飞机的改道发生在全球对俄罗斯领空使用的辩论之际一些航空公司表示，美国联合航空公司的负责人周一警告说，一架载有美国公民的飞机被迫降落在俄罗斯的危险。

;

;机上的 216 名乘客和 16 名机组人员正在接受支持印度航空公司表示，飞机降落并在当地酒店过夜。

;

;美国国务院副发言人韦丹特·帕特尔周二表示，考虑到其计划目的地，机上“很可能”有美国人。帕特尔说：“我们知道一架飞往美国的航班不得不在俄罗斯紧急降落，并将继续密切关注这一情况。”

;

;该航空公司表示计划于周三派出一架飞机接他们并飞到他们原来的目的地。 “当局正在扩大所有合作，以确保乘客尽早安全到达目的地，”它说。

;

;印度航空公司表示无法透露任何乘客详细信息。

;

;俄罗斯航空当局表示正在检查飞机降落在马加丹机场后的技术状况，并已批准备用航班于周三格林威治标准时间 0300 降落在那里。预定于格林威治标准时间 1835 离开德里。

;

;“目前，边境、海关和地方当局正在解决乘客的逗留和住宿问题，”Rosaviatsia 在当天早​​些时候表示。

;

; p>;

;俄罗斯远东鄂霍次克海沿岸港口城市马加丹的机场没有回应置评请求。

;

;俄罗斯有数十亿印度卢比无法使用

;

;在美国和欧盟对出口产品实施制裁的情况下，这架价值 2 亿美元的波音 777 飞机（其发动机由通用电气制造的备受瞩目的美国制造飞机）的维修速度有多快？

;

;2018 年，一架挪威航空公司的波音 737 在华盛顿重新实施制裁几周后因发动机问题紧急降落在伊朗，并滞留了两个多月。

;< p>;第二天，186 名乘客和 6 名机组人员得以飞离设拉子。但是，尽管该航空公司最初保证飞机也将很快被遣返，但通用电气的一家发动机合资企业等了数周才获得美国财政部的出口许可证。

;

;美国商务部没有立即回复置评请求。

;

;GE Aerospace 表示，它已获悉改道并与印度航空公司合作解决该问题。

;

;周一，印度航空公司首席执行官坎贝尔威尔逊为该航空公司使用俄罗斯领空进行了辩护，并指出该行业在连接经济、人民和文化方面发挥的关键作用。

;

;“印度航空，我们根据印度国家提供给我们的范围运营，但并非所有国家都同意，”他在国际航空运输协会 (IATA) 年会的一个小组讨论会上说。

;

;俄罗斯禁止美国航空公司和其他外国航空公司使用其领空，以报复华盛顿于 2022 年 3 月禁止俄罗斯航班飞越美国在莫斯科派军队进入乌克兰之后。

;

;印度航空公司因“peegate”丑闻被罚款，飞行员被停职

;

;然而，印度航空公司和一些海湾、中国和非洲航空公司继续飞越俄罗斯，使飞行时间更短，美国竞争对手失去竞争力。

;

;2 月，美国参议员敦促拜登政府停止中国航空公司和其他非美国航空公司在美国航线上飞越俄罗斯。

;< p>;路透社上周报道称，中国航空公司在四个新批准的往返美国的航班中避免使用俄罗斯领空。;

;事件发生后，印度航空公司似乎继续飞越俄罗斯，有四个航班飞越俄罗斯根据 FlightRadar24 的数据，周二下午的国家/地区。

;

;9 月 26 日，用于将天然气从俄罗斯输送到德国的北​​溪 1 号和 2 号管道因水下爆炸而摇晃，使它们变得毫无用处，并切断了俄罗斯数十亿美元收入的潜在来源。

;

;

;它表示，有关该阴谋的原始欧洲情报明确表明这不是流氓行动，而且乌克兰总统沃洛德米尔·泽连斯基 (Volodymyr Zelensky) 不知情的情况下，军事总司令瓦莱里·扎鲁日尼 (Valerii Zaluzzhnyi) 将军监督了这一行动。

;伊朗周二声称它制造了一种能够以 15 次飞行的高超音速导弹由于德黑兰核计划与美国的紧张局势仍然很紧张，伊朗的武器库中又增加了一种新武器。

;

;这种新型导弹——在波斯语中称为“法塔赫”或“征服者”——甚至在伊朗表示，在与利雅得多年的冲突后达成缓和关系后，它将在周二重新开放其在沙特阿拉伯的外交机构。

;

;伊朗国家电视台精心编排的片段显然试图表明德黑兰的强硬派政府可以伊朗仍在中东大部分地区部署武器打击其敌人。

;

;“今天我们感到威慑力量已经形成，”伊朗总统易卜拉欣·赖西在活动中说。 “这种力量是地区国家持久安全与和平的支柱。”

;

;准军事革命卫队航空航天计划负责人阿米尔·阿里·哈吉扎德将军揭开了导弹模型的面纱。 Hajizadeh 声称这枚导弹的射程可达 1,400 公里（870 英里）。

;

;这大约是伊朗庞大的弹道导弹武库的中等射程，伊朗卫队多年来一直在西方制裁下建立起来防止它获得先进武器。

;

;“没有任何系统可以与这种导弹匹敌或对抗这种导弹，”Hajizadeh 声称。

;

;然而，这种说法取决于导弹的机动性.弹道导弹的飞行轨迹使得像爱国者这样的反导弹系统可以预测它们的路径并拦截它们。周二的活动展示了 Fattah 似乎有一个可移动的喷嘴，这可以让它在飞行中改变轨迹。导弹的飞行路径越不规则，就越难拦截。

;

;乌克兰能否用爱国者击落俄罗斯的超级武器？

;

;伊朗官员没有公布法塔赫成功发射的镜头然后击中目标。 Hajizadeh 后来说，已经对导弹发动机进行了地面测试。

;

;地面测试包括将火箭发动机放在支架上并点火以检查其能力，同时使用该火箭发动机发射导弹的能力非常强。

;

;高超音速武器的飞行速度超过 5 马赫，即音速的五倍，由于其速度和机动性，可能对导弹防御系统构成重大挑战。伊朗将法塔赫描述为能够达到 15 马赫——这是音速的 15 倍。

;

;据信，中国和美国都在寻求这种武器。俄罗斯声称已经部署了这些武器，并表示已在乌克兰战场上使用过这些武器。然而，速度和机动性并不能保证导弹成功打击目标。乌克兰空军在 5 月表示，它用爱国者电池击落了一枚俄罗斯高超音速 Kinzhal 导弹。

;

;与美国结盟的海湾阿拉伯国家在该地区广泛使用爱国者导弹系统。以色列是伊朗在中东的主要竞争对手，也拥有自己强大的防空系统。

;

;11 月，Hajizadeh 最初声称伊朗制造了高超音速导弹，但没有提供支持它的证据。

;< p>;这一说法是在 22 岁的玛莎·阿米尼 (Mahsa Amini) 9 月被该国道德警察逮捕后死亡后的全国抗议活动中提出的。

;

;周二宣布这一消息之际，美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯 (Antony Blinken) 即将开始访问沙特阿拉伯。

;

;在美国和欧洲运营的航空公司抱怨来自中国和印度的航空公司正在收到获准进入俄罗斯领空，从而减少飞行时间和燃料成本，从而获得不公平的优势。达美航空、美国联合航空和美国航空表示，他们对俄罗斯领空的禁令使他们每年损失 20 亿美元。

;

;香港旗舰航空公司国泰航空使用该领空从纽约飞往该市，并称航线

;

;< p>;“例如，在大流行之前，我们每天在美国和印度之间进行五次飞行，现在我们飞行一次，而且多飞了两个小时。这令人失望，”他说。

; Wed, 07 Jun 2023 00:50:01 +0800 Why are doubts about China’s export data increasing amid a stalling economic recovery?https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3222697/why-are-doubts-about-chinas-export-data-increasing-amid-stalling-economic-recovery?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.07 00:00;
;;

;尽管全球需求减弱，与西方的地缘政治紧张局势加剧，但中国的出口数据仍在继续今年超出市场预期。

;

;根据海关总署的数据，3 月份出口同比增长 14.8%，4 月份同比增长 8.5%。

;

;但有越来越多的人质疑海关数据的可靠性，许多人质疑它是否好得令人难以置信。

;

;问题是出口数据与其他经济指标之间的差异越来越大。

;

;这些指标包括其他中国机构报告的调查结果或统计数据、主要贸易伙伴海关机构报告的进口数据、运价低迷以及出口商士气低落。

;

;北京已承诺支撑贸易以支持该国的大流行后经济复苏，该国在放弃严格的零 Covid 政策后短暂回升后，最近一直在失去动力。

;

;这意味着贸易数据的有效性很重要对试图在多重逆风中引导经济的中国政策制定者来说，这是一个很大的挑战。

;

;但导致怀疑的差异是什么？可能的解释是什么？

;

;出口交货值

;

;除了中国海关报告的贸易数据外，国家统计局 (NBS) 发布的以人民币为单位的“出口交货值”是衡量中国出口行业的另一个指标。

;

;它基于对年收入超过 2000 万元人民币（280 万美元）的工业企业的调查。

;

;虽然海关数据记录了每月离开中国的各种商品的价值，但出口交货值衡量的是给定月份生产和出口的工业产品的价值。

;

;“日益明显”的疲软需求使中国出口降温，放缓至 2023 年底

;

;两组数据基本移动过去同步，但在 3 月份，它们的增长率差异扩大到 28.8 个百分点，这是该局自 2014 年首次发布统计数据以来的最大差距。

;

;中国出口同比增长 23.4%海关数据显示，当月以人民币计算，出口交货值同比下降 5.4%。

;

;4 月份，差异缩小至 16.1 个百分点的高位。

;

;高盛最近的一份报告称，差距扩大的一个解释是较小的出口商（未包括在国家统计局的调查中）比较大的出口商反弹得更快。

;

;另一种可能性是许多3 月和 4 月的出口可能是在 12 月结束的 Covid-19 中断和 1 月的农历新年假期期间积压的库存。

;

;尽管中国海关数据还显示私营企业的出口增长已经尽管在过去几个月中表现优于国有和外资企业，但野村的经济学家表示，很难说较小的出口商是主要驱动力。

;

;他们指出财新制造业采购经理人指数，基于根据对东部沿海省份小型制造商的调查，3 月份下降至 50，表示零增长，4 月份下降至 49.5，表示收缩。

;

;贸易伙伴报告的进口数据

;< p>;在中国的主要贸易伙伴中，东南亚国家是过去几个月中国出口增长的主要驱动力之一。

;

;但越南、新加坡、马来西亚和与中国的出口数据相比，泰国的差异一直在扩大。

;

;差距的扩大可能是由于再出口和转运——换句话说，离开中国的货物可能没有到达声称的目的地.

;

;高盛经济学家表示，资本外流可能是另一个促成因素，因为历史上当人民币面临贬值压力时，中国和新加坡海关数据之间的差异已经扩大。

;

;

;

;中国公司有动机夸大出口价值，或者干脆与海外空壳公司进行虚假贸易以获得退税或补贴，利用外汇和利率差异，或者只是将资金转移出国。

;

;与此同时，资金紧张的地方政府也有动机夸大数据以获得中央政府的专项财政补贴。

;

;当局最近似乎对出口数据造假更加警惕。< /p>;

;3月下旬，海关关长于建华表示，海关对造假贸易数据“零容忍”，将严查贸易造假行为，确保海关数据准确无误。

;

;5月，来自江西省建井井冈山经济技术开发区网站的一篇文章称，当地官员正在研究海关关于“坚决打击假冒贸易，维护统计数据真实性”的通知。

; h3>;中国开除“伪造”经济数据、拿走“钱、礼物”的前高级官员;

;根据网上流传的一张通知图片，“审计部门最近指出，一些省份未考虑维护贸易真实性，利用虚假贸易骗取财政专项补贴，虚增进出口数据，严重影响国家对区域经济形势的公正判断和贸易政策实施的有效性”

;

;它表示问题仍在“某些地方”发生。

;

;但3月和4月价值数千亿美元的强劲出口不太可能仅仅是招商证券表示，受到数据造假的支持。

;

;野村经济学家表示，增长的主要贡献者是对俄罗斯和区域全面经济伙伴关系国家的强劲出口，以及电动汽车和电池。

; Wed, 07 Jun 2023 00:20:02 +0800 Hong Kong rural body proposes housing scheme near site of controversial golf club developmenthttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/hong-kong-economy/article/3223186/hong-kong-rural-body-proposes-housing-scheme-near-site-controversial-golf-club-development?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.06 23:30;
;;

;Rural leaders have proposed developing a farmland site for flats a day after the government, in a rare move, further delayed a controversial project to build public housing on part of Hong Kong's oldest golf course.

;

;But Heung Yee Kuk chairman Kenneth Lau Ip-keung on Tuesday denied his proposal was meant as a substitute for the nine-hectare site earmarked for building 12,000 public flats at Fanling golf course by 2029.

;

;“It is about Hong Kong's overall housing supply instead of projects substituting one another,” Lau said, stressing the government needed to build up its land bank for future development.

;

;The government on Monday night said it would change the proposed use of the golf course public housing site from residential to “undetermined”, while acknowledging the project would be delayed.

;

;A former town planning adviser called the move rare.

;

;The authorities said they remained committed to building public flats on the site, adding the change was temporary to buy time for amending the housing layout and density to fulfil requirements from environmental authorities.

;

;Lau's proposal takes up 8.5 hectares in Ping Kong Tsuen, a village with abandoned farmland and some squatter huts located next to the golf course. The plan involves constructing more than 12,000 flats in a total of nine blocks ranging from 31 to 46 floors and a low-rise building to house community facilities and a public transport interchange.

;

;Lau said villagers had told him they did not oppose the proposal, adding that the government would need to compensate land owners if it resumed the site for development.

;

;Hong Kong plan to build public housing on golf course set for further delay

;

;Under the current mechanism, agricultural land taken back for development costs HK$1,267 per square foot.

;

;Architect Julia Lau Man-kwan, who helped formulate the plan, said the proposal had an edge over the golf course scheme as the area was flat and no valuable trees required transplanting elsewhere.

;

;“It can be implemented quicker than the Fanling golf course site,” Lau said, adding the area would require existing roads to be upgraded.

;

;In response to Post inquiries, the Development Bureau on Tuesday night said the proposed village development involved a large amount of private land and had no road connections.

;

;“It requires further feasibility studies but it does not seem to be land that homes can be built on in the short term,” a bureau spokeswoman said.

;

;The Town Planning Board will hold five meetings this month for public hearings on the overall 32-hectare redevelopment plan involving the golf course, covering the “undetermined” site and the remaining 23 hectares designated for conservation and recreational uses.

;

;The board earlier received more than 6,000 responses against the housing proposal, including from the Hong Kong Golf Club which leases the land for the 172-hectare Fanling course.

;

;Once the board has reached a decision by the end of November at the latest, the government will start amending the housing proposal and submit a new plan to environmental authorities by the end of next year.

;

;A former town planning member, who declined to be named, said the board normally required project proponents to file another round of applications for any changes.

;

;“I have never seen anything like this during my term … I suspect the move is to avoid any legal challenges,” the ex-member said.

;

;A source familiar with the planning process said the temporary change was “rare”, giving the public a bad impression.

;

;“It looks like the government knows that it does not have an edge according to the comments received by the board. So it is changing the land use,” the source said, adding the move could also buy the government time to negotiate with stakeholders.

;

;Hong Kong Golf Club shares baby owl video in bid to halt housing plan for course

;

;Sze Lai-shan, deputy director of the Society for Community Organisation, expressed dissatisfaction with the delay and said she was worried the plan would be given up eventually.

;

;“It has a huge impact on those waiting for public housing,” Sze said. “Every project receives opposition. Does it mean we give up on all of them?”

;

;The Federation of Public Housing Estates remained optimistic about building flats on the golf course but stressed that the scale of the project should not fall too much.

;

;The average waiting time for public housing was 5.3 years as of March.

; Tue, 06 Jun 2023 23:50:02 +0800 Ukrainian dam breach: What is happening and what is at stakehttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/russia-central-asia/article/3223175/ukrainian-dam-breach-what-happening-and-what-stake?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.06 22:22;
;;

;The dramatic rupture of the dam that upheld Ukraine's largest reservoir released a torrent of water on Tuesday, raising fears of widespread damage and flooding in areas where tens of thousands of people live.

;

;It's not clear what caused the breach in the Kakhovka dam, which was already damaged. Ukraine accused Russian forces of blowing up the facility, while Russian officials blamed Ukrainian military strikes.

;

;

;

;The 30-metre-high (98-foot-high) dam and associated hydroelectric power station sit in Russian-controlled territory along the Dnipro River about 70 kilometres (44 miles) east of the city of Kherson – a flashpoint of Russia's war in Ukraine.

;

;Together with the power station, the Soviet-era dam helps provide electricity, irrigation and drinking water to a wide swathe of southern Ukraine, including the illegally annexed Crimean peninsula.

;

;The reservoir created by the dam holds some 18 million cubic meters (4.8 billion) of water – a volume nearly equivalent to that of the Great Salt Lake in the United States. Those waters supply cooling systems at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, where fighting has repeatedly raised fears of catastrophic accident.

;

;

;

;Russia has controlled the dam since the early days of the war. Last fall, the troops occupying it detonated explosives that damaged three sluice gates, which help regulate water levels when operated properly. Signs of damage to the gates were evident in late May.

;

;Ukrainian officials and independent experts also say Russian forces have failed to maintain it, either deliberately or through neglect.

;

;Earlier this year, water levels in the reservoir were so low that many across Ukraine and beyond feared a meltdown at the Russian-occupied Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant. Since mid-February, the water level has steadily increased, according to data from Theia, a French geospatial analytical organisation.

;

;On Tuesday, Ukrainian authorities accused Russian forces of destroying the dam. Russia says military strikes in the contested area damaged the facility.

;

;

;

;As floodwaters swelled, both Russian and Ukrainian authorities have ordered evacuations of towns and villages, though neither side reported any deaths. Officials said about 22,000 people live in areas at risk of flooding in Russian-controlled areas, while 16,000 live in the most critical zone in Ukrainian-held territory.

;

;Ukraine's Energy Ministry also said there is a risk of flooding at energy facilities in the Kherson region. Nearly 12,000 consumers in the city of Kherson have already been left without electricity, and there may be issues with water supply.

;

;Upstream, meanwhile, riverbanks extended as water levels dropped. At the Zaporizhzhia plant, Europe's largest, the Ukrainian utility operator and the UN atomic energy agency said the situation was under control and there was no immediate risk to safety.

;

;Ukrainian authorities warned about the possibility of an environmental disaster.

;

;Mykhailo Podolyak, a senior adviser to President Volodymyr Zelensky, said “a global ecological disaster is playing out” and warned that “thousands of animals and ecosystems will be destroyed in the next few hours.”

; Tue, 06 Jun 2023 22:50:02 +0800 Food security breakthrough for China with ‘new record’ rapeseed production from salty soilhttps://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3223119/food-security-breakthrough-china-new-record-rapeseed-production-salty-soil?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.06 22:30;
;;

;China has reported “record' progress in growing rapeseed in salty soil, a move expected to reduce reliance on imports amid Beijing's food security drive, although there are still seen to be “many steps” before widespread use of the technology.

;

;New salt-tolerant species and technologies were trialled in 200 mu (13.3 hectares) of salty land in Dongtai – a coastal county-level city in east China's Jiangsu province, according to a report released by China Science Daily, a newspaper affiliated with the Chinese Academy of Sciences.

;

;The report added that “a new record of rapeseed production from salty soil” was made with a total of 323.87kg (714lbs) of rapeseed per mu harvested, representing an increase of 59.5 per cent from the average yield.

;

;The total oil reproduction from the rapeseed could reach 163.17kg per mu, which represents an increase of 82.7 per cent.

;

;“There is 185 million mu of saline land currently in China that can be used for growing crops while the country is facing high risks of supply security because 70 per cent of plant-based oil is imported from overseas,” the report noted.

;

;Rapeseed is China's foremost oil producing crop that has an outstanding salt-tolerant ability.

;

;The move is the latest evidence of Beijing's self-sufficiency drive, which is believed to profoundly influence the world's major farm produce exporting nations.

;

;China imported 1.06 million tonnes of rapeseed oil last year, a fall of 50.7 per cent from a year earlier, government data showed. Russia accounted for around half of the total imports, followed by one fifth from Canada.

;

;Xi, who has long called for the rice bowl to be firmly held in the hands of Chinese people, visited saline land in the northern province of Hebei in mid-May, calling for better use of such land to enhance the country's food security.

;

;'Mine are authentic': how China's counterfeit seed problem stalls innovation

;

;China's northeast, northwest and coastal regions, the upper-middle stream of the Yellow River and the North China Plain are the five saline areas that match the climate condition to grow rapeseed.

;

;In an academic journal published in November on MDPI, Li Qing – an associate professor in management at Dalian Polytechnic University – said “rapeseed has a long history of planting in China” and its oil is one of the world's three most prominent edible oils that plays “a significant role” in the Chinese edible oil market.

;

;“Improving the efficiency of rapeseed planting and the rapeseed industry will help ensure the overall safety of the Chinese edible oil supply structure and maintain the crucial strategic significance of the self-sufficiency of rapeseed oil,” she added.

;

;James Keeley, an honorary associate at the University of Sussex's Institute of Development Studies, said that China has invested substantial resources in developing saline and alkaline tolerant crops “for many years”, and therefore “breakthroughs like this in field research” are expected.

;

;“China is dependent on overseas markets for key crops used in the production of edible oils (notably soybeans). However, there are many steps between field research and widespread uptake across a number of provinces,” he explained.

;

;“The price would also need to be competitive with imported soybean oil, and there is also consumer preference to consider.”

;

;Chinese scientists said last year that they had created a salt-tolerant soybean species that could reduce the country's dependence on imports from the likes of Brazil, where soy production is driving deforestation.

;

;Highlighting it is unclear whether the current progress made on rapeseed can be replicated in other crops, Keeley said that it is possible to identify genes and mechanisms through long-term crossbreeding that can regulate salinity and alkalinity tolerance.

; Tue, 06 Jun 2023 22:50:02 +0800 China now has the world’s most powerful hypersonic wind tunnelhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3223152/china-now-has-worlds-most-powerful-hypersonic-wind-tunnel?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.06 22:00;
;;

;After five years of construction, the most powerful wind tunnel on the planet has roared to life in China's capital – a facility that will be key to advancing Beijing's hypersonic ambitions.

;

;Located in the mountainous Huairou district of northern Beijing, the JF-22 wind tunnel is 4 metres (13 feet) in diameter and can generate air flow speeds up to 10km (6.2 miles) per second, according to a final evaluation conducted on May 30.

;

;That makes it the largest and fastest wind tunnel in the world, capable of simulating hypersonic flight conditions up to Mach 30, according to the Institute of Mechanics, the owner of the facility.

;

;The tunnel will “support the research and development of China's space transport system and hypersonic aircraft,” the institute said in a statement on Friday.

;

;By comparison, the Mach 10 tunnel at Nasa's Langley Research Centre in the United States, a primary hypersonic test facility, has a test section diameter of nearly 0.8 metres.

;

;A larger test section enables researchers to put larger aircraft models or even an entire weapon into the wind tunnel to obtain more accurate flight data.

;

;Most intercontinental missiles are under 4 metres in diameter.

;

;The JF-22 is integral to goals set out by the Chinese government to be achieved by 2035. By then, Beijing hopes to deploy a fleet of hypersonic aircraft that can carry thousands of passengers into space each year, or reach anywhere on the planet within an hour.

;

;But such aircraft must be able to withstand the extreme heat and pressure of hypersonic flight, while maintaining stable flight trajectories and a safe, comfortable environment for passengers.

;

;At five times the speed of sound, air molecules around an aircraft begin to become highly compressed and heated, leading to a phenomenon known as molecular dissociation.

;

;The air molecules break apart into their constituent atoms, which can then react with each other to form new chemicals.

;

;Private internet satellite company joins China's hypersonic race

;

;Understanding the complex physics of flows associated with molecular dissociation is crucial for the development of hypersonic aircraft, according to the institute.

;

;By studying the phenomena in a laboratory environment using facilities like wind tunnels, researchers can learn how hypersonic vehicles interact with their surrounding environment, and develop new technologies to improve their performance and safety.

;

;Wind tunnel testing can also help identify potential problems or design flaws before the vehicle is actually built and flown, reducing the risk of failure or accidents.

;

;According to some estimates, simulating the conditions of a Mach 30 flight inside a large tunnel, requires power comparable to that produced by the Three Gorges dam – a practical impossibility.

;

;So, Professor Jiang Zonglin, the lead scientist for the JF-22 project, came up with an innovative solution.

;

;To create the high-speed air flow needed for hypersonic testing, Jiang proposed a new type of shock wave generator called a “reflected direct shock wave driver”.

;

;In traditional hypersonic wind tunnels, air flow is generated by a process called “expansion,” in which high-pressure gas is rapidly released into a low-pressure chamber, creating a supersonic flow. However, this method has limitations when it comes to generating the extremely high speeds and temperatures needed for hypersonic testing.

;

;In first, Ukraine says shot down volley of Russian hypersonic missiles

;

;Jiang's reflected shock wave driver overcomes these limitations by using a series of precisely timed explosions to generate a series of shock waves that reflect off each other and converge at a single point.

;

;The resulting intense burst of energy is used to drive the air flow in the wind tunnel at extremely high speeds.

;

;The innovation has paved the way for more advances by bringing more accuracy and efficiency to the study of hypersonic flight, according to the institute.

;

;Using explosives to generate energy in a wind tunnel comes with lots of drawbacks – they are dangerous for both humans and equipment, and they produce noise and air pollution.

;

;But an explosive shock tunnel allows for a very rapid and intense burst of energy, necessary for driving the air flow in the wind tunnel at extremely high speeds.

;

;And because the energy source is generated by explosions rather than a fixed mechanical system, the intensity and timing of the explosions can be tailored to create a variety of air flows for testing different types of vehicles or materials.

;

;A team of 16 independent experts hired by the National Nature Science Foundation of China evaluated the JF-22 in several key areas, including effective testing time, total temperature, total pressure and nozzle flow field size.

;

;British chair professor joins China's hypersonic programme

;

;They concluded that the JF-22 had achieved “world leading” performance. “The JF-22 wind tunnel, together with the JF-12 wind tunnel, forms the only ground-based experimental platform that covers all flight corridors for near-space vehicles,” the institute said.

;

;The JF-12 wind tunnel, which has been operating since 2012 at the same site as the JF-22, is designed to simulate flight conditions for vehicles travelling at speeds up to Mach 9.

;

;Together, the two wind tunnels can be used in a variety of ways to test hypersonic weapons and aircraft – the JF-12 simulates flight conditions at lower speeds and temperatures, while using the JF-22 replicates more extreme conditions at higher speeds and temperatures.

;

;By combining the data, researchers can better understand how different materials and designs perform under a range of flight conditions, and use that information to improve the performance and reliability of hypersonic weapons or aircraft.

;

;The facilities could put China years ahead of its competitors, according to Jiang's team.
